#Text=Over 60 dead in Kenya cholera outbreak , state issues alert
#Text=Saturday , April 12 , 2008
#Text=State health officials in Kenya issued an alert Thursday after an outbreak of cholera killed over 60 people in the last five months .
#Text=All health personnel have been advised to actively monitor patients with diarrhea , and the government issued a ban on preparing and eating food in public gatherings .
#Text=Nyanza Province
#Text=, with 750 infections and 45 deaths , has felt the brunt of the outbreak .
#Text=Over 1,200 cases have been reported in the provinces of Nyanza , Rift Valley , North Eastern and Western .
#Text=According to Agence France-Presse , officials have reported 45 people dead in Nyanza Province , 12 in North Eastern Province and seven in Rift Valley Province .
#Text=Health officials have stated that the actual number of deaths due to the outbreak could be higher due to under reporting .

#Text=The mass movement of people during the post-election crisis may also have contributed to the outbreak of the disease as people found themselves in areas with inadequate water and sanitation facilities .
#Text=— SK Sharif , senior deputy director of health services in Nyanza Province
#Text=SK Sharif , senior deputy director of health services in Nyanza , commented on contributing factors to the outbreak :

#Text=" The mass movement of people during the post-election crisis may also have contributed to the outbreak of the disease as people found themselves in areas with inadequate water and sanitation facilities " .
#Text=Health workers are working to contain the outbreak , and are focusing efforts on areas affected by violence related to the December elections .
#Text=Suba
#Text=, Migori , Homabay , Rongo , Siaya , Kisumu , Bondo , Nyando , Kisii , Wajir , Mandera , Naivasha , Nakuru and Bunyala are among the worst affected districts .
#Text=The possibility of a disease outbreak in Kenya was previously raised by health officials , specifically in camps where hundreds of thousands of displaced people reside .
#Text=Revenge killings , tribal fighting and upheaval following the December elections in Kenya has displaced many in the country .

#Text=Titus Mung'ou , spokesman for Kenya Red Cross Society , told Agence France-Presse " We are trying to reduce the prevalence of the mix up that may happen by scrutinising food donations that are brought in the camps , but mostly we are ensuring that all the water is well treated " .
#Text=In a news conference Thursday in Nairobi , Director of Medical Service Dr. James Nyikal said that if urgent measures were not undertaken to control the outbreak , it could become much worse .
#Text=" Most deaths occurred at home or on the way to hospital , " said Dr. Nyikal .
#Text=Medicines worth KSh 17.3 million ( GBP 2.4 million ) and other equipment worth KSh700,000 ( GBP 5,700 ) has been sent to the affected areas .
#Text=The Kenyan government has allocated KSh38 million ( GBP 11.75 million ) to contain the outbreak .
#Text=Boiling drinking water or treating water with chlorine and practising good toilet manners are necessary to avoid contamination .
#Text=— Dr. David Okello , World Health Organization Country Director

#Text=On Friday the Health Ministry requested aid from the United Nations Children 's Fund , and Dr. Nyikal stated : " Health workers are a problem and we have written to Unicef , requesting assistance .

#Text= We are particularly concerned by risk areas such as eating premises and bus stops in major towns such as Busia , Kisumu , Kericho , Nakuru , Naivasha , Nairobi , Voi , Mtito Andei and Mombasa " .

column1: #Text=World Health Organization

#Text=Country Director Dr. David Okello emphasized the importance of hygiene , stating : " We need to emphasise the importance of water safety and the public needs to adopt the measures of keeping water safe .
